items.title: Vanilla
items.description: The latest ECMAScript standard development gives ES6 (and beyond) many functions javascript was previously missing. Javascript development doesn't demand a library anymore, with plain or vanilla covering the basics and a compiler (Babel) covering cross-browser support.

items.title: Zepto
items.description:
Zepto is build as a lightweight variant of jQuery, supporting the same syntax, but with less old browser support (e.g. from IE10+).

http://zeptojs.com/

items.title: underscore.js
items.description:
Underscore is a more advanced library, but its development is getting less attention.

http://underscorejs.org/

items.title: Lodash
items.description:
Lodash has become the default library for modern javascript development.

https://lodash.com/

items.title: MooTools
items.description:
MooTool is no longer being actively maintained.

https://mootools.net/

items.title: jQuery
items.description:
jQuery is the most well know and most used javascript library to this day. Its accessible for beginners as well as experts. Its signature style is the $ character followed by a selector. It continues to be in active development even after 10 years.

https://jquery.com/
